meanings.definition: Material used to cover the inner surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The linings of the jacket kept me warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a soft lining into the coat to make it more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the linings of the curtains, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was like the linings of a cloud, always there to provide comfort.
meanings.sent5: The bright red linings of the bag made it easy to spot in a crowded room.

meanings.definition: A layer of fabric or other material that covers the inside of a garment.
meanings.sent1: The silk linings of the dress added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent2: He carefully inspected the linings of the suit to ensure they were well-made.
meanings.sent3: The linings of the costume were so colorful that they stole the show.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the linings of a rainbow, bringing joy to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The linings of the bag were torn, revealing the poor quality of the material.

meanings.definition: The act of adding a lining to something.
meanings.sent1: The linings of the curtains were done with precision and care.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of linings to improve the durability of her creations.
meanings.sent3: The linings of the cake were so thick that it became the main attraction.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his work was like the linings of a shield, protecting him from criticism.
meanings.sent5: The linings of the bag were sewn by hand, showcasing the artisan's skill.
